column1: occupation  or possession of State land,  such person could be ejected from  the Land in an appropn'ate
civil action.  The clear object of the State Lands (Recovery of Possession) Act,  is to secure possession of
such land by an expeditious machinery without recourse to an ordinary civil action.  The dicta  of the
Supreme Court in the case of Weerakoon  vs. Ranhamy and the passage of the Canadian judgement
quoted by Professor  Wade,  therefore do  not have a bearing on this case. Accordingly,  the application
of the Petitioner is dismissed with costs. "
